sen.j: 電電宮（でんでんぐう）は、京都市西京区嵐山の法輪寺の鎮守社で、電気・電波の祖神として信仰されている神社である。
sen.e: Denden-gu Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Arashiyama, Nishigyo Ward, Kyoto City and enshrines deities that are worshipped as pioneers in the field of electricity and electromagnetic waves.

sen.j: 法輪寺は奈良時代に創建された虚空蔵菩薩を本尊とする寺院である。
sen.e: Horin-ji Temple was founded during the Nara period and is dedicated to the principal image Kokuzo Bosatsu.

sen.j: 後に神仏習合の流れで法輪寺にも鎮守社が作られた。
sen.e: The later syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism led to the construction of a Shinto shrine within the temple grounds.

sen.j: 奈良時代の僧・道昌がこの地で行った求聞持法の満願の日に、空から明星が降りそそいで虚空蔵菩薩が示現したということから、その明星を表す明星天子を本地仏として、雷の神である電電明神を祀る明星社が鎮守社の一つとして作られた。
sen.e: It was said the morning star (Venus) fell from the sky and Kokuzo Bosatsu appeared on the day that the vow made by the Nara period monk Dosho during a questioning ritual held on the site was fulfilled, and based on this legend, Myojo-sha Shrine was built to enshrine he lightning god Denden-Myojin as the embodiment of Myojo Tenshi who represents the star.

sen.j: 古くから雷の神は田の神と同一視されたこともあり、電電宮は住民から広く信仰されていた。
sen.e: Since ancient times, the god of lightning has also been regarded as the god of paddy fields and Denden-gu Shrine was widely worshipped by local residents.

sen.j: しかし、元治元年（1864年）の禁門の変により、本堂などとともに焼失し、長く仮宮に鎮座したままとなっていた。
sen.e: However, the shrine was destroyed by fire along with the temple's main hall during the Hamaguri rebellion of 1864 and the deity was long enshrined within a temporary shrine.

sen.j: 昭和31年（1956年）、当時の近畿電波管理局長・平林金之助は、今後電波の利用が多くなることから、電電明神を電気電波の祖神として祀り、併せて電気電波関連の研究先覚者や事業者の霊を顕彰すべきであると主唱した。
sen.e: Due to the increasing use of radio devices, in 1956 Kinnosuke HIRABAYASHI, the then Director of the Kinki Bureau of Telecommunications, advocated that Denden Myojin be enshrined as the god of electricity and electromagnetic waves and that the shrine should also publicly honor the spirits of pioneering researchers and entrepreneurs in fields related to electricity and electromagnetic waves.

sen.j: これに賛同した関西の電気電波関連者らにより明星社が再興され（ただし社殿は仮宮のままであった）、併せて法輪寺境内に電気電波関係者の霊を顕彰する電電塔が建てられた。
sen.e: This met with the agreement of those active in electricity and radio within the Kansai region and the shrine was restored (although the shrine retained its temporary buildings) with the Denden-to Pagoda being constructed within the grounds of Horin-ji Temple to honor the spirits of those who pioneered electricity and radio.

sen.j: 電電塔には電気研究者の代表としてトーマス・エジソン、電波研究者の代表としてハインリヒ・ヘルツの銅製の肖像が掲げられている。
sen.e: Copper statues of Thomas Edison and Heinrich Hertz stand in the Denden-to Pagoda to represent electricity researchers and electromagnetic wave researchers respectively.

sen.e: The shrine was rebuilt and renamed Denden-gu Shrine in 1966 to commemorate Expo '70 held in Osaka.

sen.e: In January 1979, the Denden-gu Goji-kai, an association to preserve Denden-gu Shrine (Denden-gu Shrine Hosan-kai and Denden-to Pagoda Hosan-kai) was formed and the organization is working to maintain Denden-gu Shrine and Denden-to Pagoda.

sen.e: Today the shrine is worshipped not only for pioneers of electricity and electromagnetic wave research but also for persons involved in computers and telecommunications.
